content.description: Grasp the face on good holds and a good right foot.  Slap up right for a decent rounded corner, set feet and shoot to the depression 3 feet up.
content.protection: Crash pad.  Old stump was removed from the base that was a back breaker.
content.location: Uphill 30 feet across the trail to the west of Overlap Wall.

content.description: Slab Crack climbs a fun but short hands/fist crack on a featured slab. The crux is at the top, where you are forced to use the crack as features on the slab disappear. The climb is not worth the approach but is fun to do if you happen to be hiking along the trail.
content.protection: The crack is very secure and low angle, so hauling gear is probably not worth the effort. It could probably take #2 c4s.
content.location: Hike along the Sheep Mountain Trail until the trail goes through the obvious cut in the granite. Turn around, and the formation should be clearly visible.

content.description: Climb the center of the face thru the overlaps to a good jug to top out on.  Could be made easier using the right rounded edge, stick to the face and it is thin.
content.location:
10 feet right of

Crimper Corner

on the obvious overlap.

content.description: Grab the large pocket on the east face and pull to the lichen covered top.
content.location: South on the trail 30 feet and uphill 20 feet from Overlap Wall, west side of the trail.

content.description: Place your feet on the bottom and grab a semi-painful, crimper edge with the right.  Do a long reach or short dyno to a grove in the top and pull up.
content.location:
Left side of the Overlap Wall 10 feet right of

Bucket Brigade

.

content.description: At the near edge of the overlap wall ( left most as you face the rock) is a short problem with an obvious water hole bucket.
